publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2880 Ms Margo MacDonald: Palestine-That the Parliament condemns the policies of the Israeli government towards Palestinians; urges the Prime Minister to use his best efforts to convince the government of Ariel Sharon that the continued brutality in territory occupied illegally by Israel under resolutions of the United Nations has resulted in the inevitability of the establishment of the State of Palestine, and counsels that this Israeli government and future governments should seek for this to be realised in peaceful co-operation between the State of Israel and the future State of Palestine.
S1M-2880 Palestine (lodged on 12 March 2002) Bill Butler*
S1M-2880 Palestine (lodged on 12 March 2002) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-2880 Ms Margo MacDonald: Palestineâ€”That the Parliament condemns the policies of the Israeli government towards Palestinians; urges the Prime Minister to use his best efforts to convince the government of Ariel Sharon that the continued brutality in territory occupied illegally by Israel under resolutions of the United Nations has resulted in the inevitability of the establishment of the State of Palestine, and counsels that this Israeli government and future governments should seek for this to be realised in peaceful co-operation between the State of Israel and the future State of Palestine. Supported by: Bill Butler, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-2880 Palestine (lodged on 12 March 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-2880 Palestine (lodged on 12 March 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Christine Grahame*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2880 Palestine (lodged on 12 March 2002) Mr John McAllion*
S1M-2880 Palestine (lodged on 12 March 2002) Robin Harper*
S1M-2880 Palestine (lodged on 12 March 2002) Pauline McNeill*
S1M-2880 Palestine (lodged on 12 March 2002) Elaine Smith*, Susan Deacon*, Ms Sandra White*
